verses.plain: Boast not thyself of to morrow; for thou knowest not what a day may bring forth.

tokens.t: Boast not thyself of to morrow; for thou knowest not what a day may bring forth.

verses.plain: Let another man praise thee, and not thine own mouth; a stranger, and not thine own lips.

tokens.t: Let another man praise thee, and not thine own mouth; a stranger, and not thine own lips.

verses.plain: A stone is heavy, and the sand weighty; but a fool’s wrath is heavier than them both.

tokens.t: A stone
heavy, and the sand weighty; but a fool’s wrath
heavier than them both.

verses.plain: Wrath is cruel, and anger is outrageous; but who is able to stand before envy?

tokens.t: Wrath
cruel, and anger
outrageous; but who
able to stand before envy?

verses.plain: Open rebuke is better than secret love.

tokens.t: Open rebuke
better than secret love.

verses.plain: Faithful are the wounds of a friend; but the kisses of an enemy are deceitful.

tokens.t: Faithful
the wounds of a friend; but the kisses of an enemy
deceitful.

verses.plain: The full soul loatheth an honeycomb; but to the hungry soul every bitter thing is sweet.

tokens.t: The full soul loatheth an honeycomb; but to the hungry soul every bitter thing is sweet.

verses.plain: As a bird that wandereth from her nest, so is a man that wandereth from his place.

tokens.t: As a bird that wandereth from her nest, so
a man that wandereth from his place.

verses.plain: Ointment and perfume rejoice the heart: so doth the sweetness of a man’s friend by hearty counsel.

tokens.t: Ointment and perfume rejoice the heart: so
the sweetness of a man’s friend by hearty counsel.

verses.plain: Thine own friend, and thy father’s friend, forsake not; neither go into thy brother’s house in the day of thy calamity: for better is a neighbour that is near than a brother far off.

tokens.t: Thine own friend, and thy father’s friend, forsake not; neither go into thy brother’s house in the day of thy calamity:
better
a neighbour
near than a brother far off.

verses.plain: My son, be wise, and make my heart glad, that I may answer him that reproacheth me.

tokens.t: My son, be wise, and make my heart glad, that I may answer him that reproacheth me.

verses.plain: A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself; but the simple pass on, and are punished.

tokens.t: A prudent
foreseeth the evil,
hideth himself;
the simple pass on,
are punished.

verses.plain: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger, and take a pledge of him for a strange woman.

tokens.t: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger, and take a pledge of him for a strange woman.

verses.plain: He that blesseth his friend with a loud voice, rising early in the morning, it shall be counted a curse to him.

tokens.t: He that blesseth his friend with a loud voice, rising early in the morning, it shall be counted a curse to him.

verses.plain: A continual dropping in a very rainy day and a contentious woman are alike.

tokens.t: A continual dropping in a very rainy day and a contentious woman are alike.

verses.plain: Whosoever hideth her hideth the wind, and the ointment of his right hand, which bewrayeth itself.

tokens.t: Whosoever hideth her hideth the wind, and the ointment of his right hand,
bewrayeth

verses.plain: Iron sharpeneth iron; so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.

tokens.t: Iron sharpeneth iron; so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.

verses.plain: Whoso keepeth the fig tree shall eat the fruit thereof: so he that waiteth on his master shall be honoured.

tokens.t: Whoso keepeth the fig tree shall eat the fruit thereof: so he that waiteth on his master shall be honoured.

verses.plain: As in water face answereth to face, so the heart of man to man.

tokens.t: As in water face
to face, so the heart of man to man.

verses.plain: Hell and destruction are never full; so the eyes of man are never satisfied.

tokens.t: Hell and destruction are never full; so the eyes of man are never satisfied.

verses.plain: As the fining pot for silver, and the furnace for gold; so is a man to his praise.

tokens.t: the fining pot for silver, and the furnace for gold; so
a man to his praise.

verses.plain: Though thou shouldest bray a fool in a mortar among wheat with a pestle, yet will not his foolishness depart from him.

tokens.t: Though thou shouldest bray a fool in a mortar among wheat with a pestle,
will not his foolishness depart from him.

verses.plain: Be thou diligent to know the state of thy flocks, and look well to thy herds.

tokens.t: Be thou diligent to know the state of thy flocks,
look well to thy herds.

verses.plain: For riches are not for ever: and doth the crown endure to every generation?

tokens.t: For riches
not for ever: and doth the crown
to every generation?

verses.plain: The hay appeareth, and the tender grass sheweth itself, and herbs of the mountains are gathered.

tokens.t: The hay appeareth, and the tender grass sheweth itself, and herbs of the mountains are gathered.

verses.plain: The lambs are for thy clothing, and the goats are the price of the field.

tokens.t: The lambs
for thy clothing, and the goats
the price of the field.

verses.plain: And thou shalt have goats’ milk enough for thy food, for the food of thy household, and for the maintenance for thy maidens.

tokens.t: And
goats’ milk enough for thy food, for the food of thy household, and
the maintenance for thy maidens.

footnotes.text: Wrath…: Heb. Wrath is cruelty, and anger an overflowing
by…: Heb. from the counsel of the soul
to…: Heb. to generation and generation?
